com.percussion.pso.validation
Class PSOFileUploadValidation

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.pso.validation.PSOFileUploadValidation
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.percussion.extension.IPSExtension, com.percussion.extension.IPSFieldValidator, com.percussion.extension.IPSUdfProcessor
public class PSOFileUploadValidation
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.percussion.extension.IPSFieldValidator

A Rhythmyx post-exit to perform content field validation. This exit uses the same code as in in the com.percussion.extensions.general.PSFileInfo class.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Roy Kiesler

Specified by:
init in interface com.percussion.extension.IPSExtension
Parameters:
extensionDef - default extension definition
codeRoot - the 'root' directory for this extension.
Throws:
com.percussion.extension.PSExtensionException - if the codeRoot does not exist, or is not accessible. Also thrown for any other initialization errors that will prohibit this extension from doing its job correctly, such as invalid or missing properties.

processUdf

public java.lang.Object processUdf(java.lang.Object[] params,
                                   com.percussion.server.IPSRequestContext request)
                            throws com.percussion.data.PSConversionException
Specified by:
processUdf in interface com.percussion.extension.IPSUdfProcessor
Parameters:
params - list of parameters
  • fieldName - the name attribute of the PSXField that is mapped to a sys_File control. Cannot be null.
  • maxSize - the maximum allowed file size (in bytes); (-1) means unlimited.
  • mimeTypes - comma-separated list of allowed Mime types, e.g., text/html, image/jpeg, etc.
request - the request context object
Returns:
the result document, if no validation errors encountered; otherwise, an instance of PSItemErrorDoc.
Throws:
com.percussion.data.PSConversionException - if an error occurred during data conversion. This exception takes two parameters, a message code and an argument. You should always pass in zero (0) for the message code.

An example of usage in a content editor definition follows:

<FieldRules>
  <PSXFieldValidationRules>
    <PSXRule>
      <PSXExtensionCallSet id="0">
        <PSXExtensionCall id="0">
          <name>Java/user/PSOFileUploadValidation</name>
          <PSXExtensionParamValue id="0">
            <value>
              <PSXTextLiteral id="0">
                <text>fileupload</text>
              </PSXTextLiteral>
            </value>
          </PSXExtensionParamValue>
          <PSXExtensionParamValue id="1">
            <value>
              <PSXTextLiteral id="0">
                <text>50000</text>
              </PSXTextLiteral>
            </value>
          </PSXExtensionParamValue>
          <PSXExtensionParamValue id="1">
            <value>
              <PSXTextLiteral id="0">
                <text>text/plain</text>
              </PSXTextLiteral>
            </value>
          </PSXExtensionParamValue>
        </PSXExtensionCall>
      </PSXExtensionCallSet>
    </PSXRule>
    <ErrorMessage>
      <PSXDisplayText>File size exceeds limit</PSXDisplayText>
    </ErrorMessage>
  </PSXFieldValidationRules>
</FieldRules>

doValidation

private boolean doValidation(com.percussion.server.IPSRequestContext request)
                      throws com.percussion.data.PSConversionException
Perform validation - executes file upload validation routines

Parameters:
request - the request context
Returns:
false if validation fails
Throws:
com.percussion.data.PSConversionException - if an error occurred during data conversion. This exception takes two parameters, a message code and an argument. You should always pass in zero (0) for the message code. to the error document
